**~Method specification datatype**


      ~An ~Eliom service ~(see <<a_api subproject="server" | type Eliom_service_sigs.S.t >>~) can respond to
      one of the following ~H~T~T~P methods~:


* ~G~E~T ~(<<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|~Get g>>~)
* ~P~O~S~T ~(<<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|~Post ~(g~, p~)>>~)
* ~P~U~T ~(<<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|~Put g>>~)
* ~D~E~L~E~T~E ~(<<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|~Delete g>>~)

      ~In all cases~, the service parameters need to be provided ~(see
      <<a_api subproject="server" | module type Eliom_parameter_sigs.S >>~)~. ~P~O~S~T ~(<<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|~Post ~(g~, p~)>>~) services accept
      both ~G~E~T ~(<<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|g>>~) and ~P~O~S~T ~(<<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|p>>~) parameters~. ~For the other methods~,
      only ~G~E~T ~(<<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|g>>~) parameters apply~.


      ~The type parameters are used to impose various type constraints~,
      and are not necessarily of interest to the programmer~. ~Their
      technical meaning is as follows~.


* ~0~-th param ~: method
* params ~1~-~4 ~: ~G~E~T and ~P~O~S~T parameter types and names
* param ~5    ~: suffix parameters permitted or not
* param ~6    ~: non~-unit only for the <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|~Post ~(g~, p~)>> case when <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|g>> is
                     not unit ~; used to force unit ~G~E~T parameters when
                     needed
